snippet: “Sinatra: An American Icon” will open in March at the New York Public Library for the Performing Arts.
abstract: “Sinatra: An American Icon” will open in March at the New York Public Library for the Performing Arts.
lead_paragraph: It is a full year until Frank Sinatra’s centenary – Friday would have been his 99th birthday – but the New York Public Library for the Performing Arts is starting its celebration early. In a collaboration with the Grammy Museum of Los Angeles and the Sinatra family, the library will present “Sinatra: An American Icon,” an exhibition that will recognize Sinatra’s work as a singer and as an actor. The exhibition opens on March 4 at the library’s Donald and Mary Oenslager Gallery and will run through Sept. 4.

headline.main: Sinatra Exhibition Set for Performing Arts Library

keywords.value: New York Public Library for the Performing Arts
